alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:54PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Limestone County through 715 PM CDT... At 653 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Ardmore, or 11 miles north of Athens, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens, Ardmore, Elkmont, Leggtown, Cartwright and Holland Gin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central Alabama.
